what the hell is this about? ok now what the hell happened to my goddamned New Years resolutions!! 1. Stop biting fingernails...NOTE TO SELF-keep getting nails done 2.Lose mass amounts of weight before spring break.....ok I hate this whole goddamned society and how fucking pressed it is on everyone looking like CALISTA FUCKING FLOCKHART! I mean seriously, if I was meant to be thin, would god have given me the best ass in the universe?! 3. Be true to myself- ok now everytime that I think that I am getting ahead on this one, I slip into one of my bottomless mood swings....I seriously need to go see a shrink or something because besides the fact that I am like way ADD I am MAJOR bipolar... Sometimes, even with all my friends and family and my "booming" aura, I feel completely alone. Like I'm standing in a pit, flailing my arms around for someone to give a shit and when my open my mouth to scream nothing comes out....just a monotonous drone like the sounds that are constantly flailing around me. So I say that I am going to try harder, work harder, consume myself in life so that I can't get hurt.\ But I always do. We always do. And I always hold everything to myself. I hold it tight tight tight so that no one can touch it and then when I let lose, when I finally lose touch with reality, it's too late and I'm screaming out at the top of my lungs to a crowd of uncaring foes. And I can't cry because that will make me weak and I must stay strong for everyone else. I must.

Ever since I was two I have wanted to embody this woman because she is always herself and on this record she does not disappoint. My hat's off. White Stripes- Elephant A totally phenomenal band. They truly do rock my socks off. With their totally live riffs and classy beat styles, they are a legacy waiting to happen. Diana Krall- Live in Paris the sexiest, smokiest voice inm the industry. Diana Krall is like the Billie Holiday of our time. She's a wonder to behold. When you hear her belt those notes you will never forget it. Norah Jones- Come Away With Me You know it took me awhile to truly get in to Ms. Nora and now that I have I'm in love with her.....she kicks my ass with her piano playing. My favorite song has got to be "I've got to see you again". check it out it's numba 9. Coldplay- A Rush of Blood to the Head Such an amazing group. So original and so chockful of talent. They're really what the industry needs right now: CREATIVITY! Please tell that all of the Blink 182 wannabees-please get a gimmick! Sublime- Sublime Seriously kids, this is like my favorite band of all time....no one can touch them in the area of beats, lyrics, depper meanings....shit they are just PHENOMENAL.....it's bands like this that show what the pressures of the industry can do to you.....they may be broken up but the beauty of sublime is withheld in their music. Matchbox Twenty- More Than you think you Are Pete Yorn- Days I forgot Linkin Park- Meteora Incubus- Morning View Beck- Sea Change

How I spent my summer Vacation by Jessamyn Olivia "DiAmOnDeEvA" Stanley This has been one of the most rewarding summers of my entire life. I've made some great friendships, renewed some old ones and made a complete ass out of myself( but had a blast doing it). Holla to the Pegasus Project kids : ZOR-RO!Kudos to the Coldstone kids: Niki, Carmi, Huddy and Katie ....Muchos love to all of my men of the summer ( even you Twenty ) and lots of love and phone calls to Joshie . Unbelievable love and memories to Bryce , you're my big brother and never forget that. Love to my auntie tracy and thanks for the Cook-Out milkshakes. Kudos to Emma for tons of rides, trips to Wally World, love and guys. Don't forget to visit this year. Lots of love to the "No Words" kids :VeeRee, Simone, Ajouli and Crystal . Lots of late nights online with Zach, Pokey and Hakky : Speaking of Zach Morris , much love and kudos for being there for me the whole summer. I hope we continue our friendship and allow it to grow and progress as it will. Thanks to Jen and Arlane for keeping me up to date on the Salem gossip. Kudos to Nata N. and Nata A. especially for listening to all my bullshit without complaints. And continuous love and kudos to my gangstas and the SSSS. Party on kids. I hope you all enjoyed this summer as much as I did.

Shirin: you know, our mom used to get us in so much trouble when we were little. Remona: YOUR MOM, Joyce? What'd she do? Leila: yeah our mom used to make us do all of these things that were against the law. Shirin: yeah Leila remember that time she made you drive down the freeway in the broken down car? Leila goes, "But mom I'm only 14, I don't have a liscence!" and mom goes, "Oh Leila don't be a wimp no one will see." Leila: So of course I got pulled over. Shirin: And then this other time when we were getting mangos out of a tree in Costa Rica, and mom goes, "Shirin, I want that mango up there at the top" , and I go, "But mom that's really high up" and she goes, "No not that one! I want the one at the VERY TOP! Go get it for me Shirin!" and I started climbing and I said, "mom this branch is kinda thin" and she'd go, "oh just get the mango you big baby!" Leila: (dying of laughter) Remember when we would go to the pool.? Mom would say "you don't need swimming lessons!" and push us into the pool! And we'd be flailing around saying, "Mom we can't swim! We need the float arms!" and she'd say, "Oh you don't need those things. Just do your arms like this (she makes a swimming motion with her arms) (Just then Joyce walks into the room, lecturing my cousin Laura on something. Joyce leaves the room and Laura sits next to Shirin) Shirin: It's ok if you think our mom is weird Laura. Everyone else does to.

Ok I gotta get somethin off my chest. I don't have a therapist to tell it to either so I just have to tell it to you. I'm in love. And I dont mean high school puppy love. I mean I love this guy. I want to marry him and have his babies. Well not just yet but one day. I want to wake up and be in his arms. I want to be able to give myself to him completely. But there's a problem. You know, one day, I'll die. And my physical body will rot away into a worm eaten oblivion but I don't want for people to think of me as "Jessamyn, that girl I knew" or Jessamyn "the girl with the weird name". I want to live my life with the turbulance and vivacity of a wild night that never leaves your mind. I want to be interesting, and dorky, and totally off the wall. I want to give people something they've never had before. I want to live.
Don't hate. Appreciate.

I have nothing to post. Actually, I have several things I would like very much to post, but I can't express my actual thoughts without facing consequences. I wish I could say things, and for once, people wouldn't have a snappy comeback. They would stand there stunned. Maybe they would even cry. And maybe I would even be happy that I had made them cry. Because that means I actually have some sort of power. And that's all I want isn't it? To be powerful and enigmatic. I want to be noticed when I enter a room. To have some kind of presence. To leave people in awe. But that only happens in movies. There aren't many people like that in real life. Posted by: Caitlin / 8:56 PM Ok it's official: Caitlin is my goddess.

Ok so I dreamt of Kate last night. Twice in a row. Really fuckin' weird dreams. In the first dream, Kate and Sarah Campbell were chillin on a bench somewhere near school, smoking. And then I came up to them and then we were all smoking. And then Caroline Phillips and gave the two of them joints but the joints were weird. They were in mechanical pencils so you have to suck on the eraser part of the pencil in order to get buzzed. And those were some hardcore pencil joints. Kate and Sarah were getting ROYALLY fucked up. And then Ms. Ellis walked up to us and was like "are you two smoking marijuana?" And Kate and Sarah were like "uhhhh no?" And then Ms. Ellis was like "You two are getting 1500 demerits and will be expelled immediately". And I remember distinctly thinking two things: 1. Why would Sarah be getting expelled, she doesn't go to our school? 2. Why would they get demerits AND expulsion? If they're expelled, what difference does the number of demerits make? So then Ms. Ellis was pulling them to Dr. B's office by their ears and on her way out she grabbed my physics book. And I was like " SHIT ! THAT'S MINE!" And Ms. Ellis stopped dead in her tracks and said "what did you say?" and I said" ohhh you're mad I said SHIT. Well I think I'll say it again: SHIT, SHIT, SHIT, SHIT, SHIT, SHIT, FUCK, FUCK, FUCK, MOTHERFUCKER!" and Ms. Ellis got really mad and threw this random bag of mozzerella cheese at my head. And then I picked up my cigarette, took a really, ridiculously long drag and tossed it in her hair and walked away. Then suddenly I was in the library and Ms. T came in with Ms. Ellis and asked me if I had used obscene language towards her. And I looked all shocked and said "Of course not! Ms. Ellis is my absolute favorite teacher! But she did throw this at my head" And I pulled out the bag of mozzerella and Ms. T was SO APPALLED at Ms. Ellis' behavior that she fired her. And she believed every single word that I said. And then Kate told me that I was her hero. In the next dream, I was walking through the rec room late at night with Gabrielle and we saw this big hump in the couch cushions and we picked up one of the cushions and Kate was underneath it, snorting coke off of the couch cushion. And then she told us not to tell anyone that we saw her there. Then there were all of these junkies like allover the room, and Kate ran out of the room and Gabrielle and I were left there with the zombie junkies. They were like searching our pockets for drugs and when we said we didn't have any, they went crazy. I remember they were all wearing random band t-shirts, but they were all different. And then the cops came in and started chaining people to the walls and Gabrielle and I started running away and then we saw these two police officers carrying Kate down the hall to the rec room to chain her up. I remember she looked so incredibly sedated that I was scared for her. And I remember she was wearing a t-shirt that said "Brian Molko, will you marry me?" And she looked at me and I couldn't just leave her like that. So I ran up to the police officers and started kicking them, trying to make them drop her. But then they stood her up against the wall and pressed a gun to her temple and told me that if I didn't move then they would shoot her. And I pushed her out of the way and put my forehead where the gun was and told them that they'd have to kill me instead. And then Kate pushed a gun into my back and said she was going to kill me. She told me I shouldn't have trusted her. And I thought to myself, "You two-faced junkie ass bitch, I'm trying to save your life" And then I woke up. And the moral of this story is: Don't sniff glue. The End.

So last night, I hear a knock at my back door. and it's incredibly late so I'm kind of scared. The knock woke up my dad so he went to the door with me and when we opened it and it was Max, I can't say my father was all too pleased. He asked why the hell Max was here and it was practically midnight. Max had no legitimate reason except that he was bored and in the area. He wanted to go to IHOP but my dad was in a bad mood so he told us to stay in the house and shut up. So Max and I made cookie sandwiches and sat around in the basement, swapping "manly stories". It was actually kind of sad, since he's moving to Georgia to live with his father. But it's weird because he came all the way over to my house to say nothing. And we're not even very good friends. (I really think the only reason he came over is because he gave up drinking for lent and he needed to be around alcohol-free/boring me to keep him sober. Whatever). But we had fun. And a few things happened that I can't say online for fear of who reads this but I will say: Max has some of the best lips on earth, fo sho.

ohhh, I feel so bad, so bad, so bad.... It's been awhile since I've been this depressed. But the last time I was like this, it was because things were going really really shitty. And now they're not. In fact, they've been really, really good. But for some reason, in the middle of the day today I realized that I'm incredibly depressed about something but I'm not even really sure what it is. And I cried. For the first time in ages, I really cried. I hadn't cried like this since like, February after MMISL audits. I got up to put out my candle and I was listening to Jump Little Children and I fell down, I don't know if it was the song or I was just crying too hard. Either way I just couldn't control myself. And I have no reason to be upset. Everything has been going great. I just can't appreciate what I have, that's all. I want to see them. Fuck this sad shit. Let me smoke my marlboro and I'll be on my way. Have a great weekend, children. Oh and looking past the sadness, I have some additions to my 'I love' list: nail salons, lotion, body parts, cd covers, drum solos, and big headphones.

A send-off to a very interesting/exhausting/fanTABulous Alabama Adventure By Jessamyn Olivia "DiAmOnDeEvA" Stanley* So yes, this weekend has been really off the wall. A bunch of royally fucked up events strung together in a really wild series that I'm still reeling from. From kick ass eggrolls (and YES, I AM a connoiseur of Chinese Takeout, smartass) unbelievably hot/humid temperatures, and swapping 'manly stories' to fabulous breakfasts at IHOP (not QUITE the new Waffle House, Wilhem), dressing up like a princess, and swing dancing at the Jazz Festival ("I've never swing danced with a BOY before!"). But first, although I am the reigning diva and queen in the story of my life, I must thank certain members of this weekend's rather eccentric cast of characters : To WILL (aka Willy Boy, WILLONEY, and dipshit)- Lover, even though I treat you like shit, I have never met anyone nearly as consistant in true, raw emotion as you are. You may think you mean absolutely nothing to me romantically and (while this is not entirely untrue :/) I am always appreciative of the lovely compliments that you constantly bestow upon me ("Wow, you look really great, Jessa. Can we fuck now?"). Through it all you'll always be my best pal and I'll never forget a time when you meant something to me romantically. Ok so let's get to the real shit: Thanks for cheese omlettes, running shoes, vinyl records, sports bras, great fortunes, "super duper" chinese chicken, Guys and Dolls, fabulous dancing, obscene t-shirts, and bad, bad, BAD directions (I must say, you really are the WORST backseat driver that I've ever had the pleasure of carting around in a rental car). To ABRAHAM (aka the sexy beast and King Bone)- Ok you know what, you'll never fucking read this (unless by some strange twist of fate you get this link) so I guess I can say: YOU'RE A SEXY BEAST. Seriously, Bone, if you were ever in the mood (because god knows, I always am) you could DEFINATELY have your way with me...Ok so thanks for teaching me to REALLY play the piano and that dancing isn't just for Christ School dances. Also, thanks for great mix cds, having my back and babysitting techniques (I might try them out one day. To SIDNEY, BRIANNA, and JORDAN (aka my " deevas " in training)- You three are fabulous. Fabulous singers and people (not just little kids). I promise that this time I WILL write you, Sid, and when you guys get to be my age and I'm old (like 26 ), I'll tell you stories of when you were young and used to think that boys had cooties (which is true) and that your whole lives revolved around sprinklers. Thanks for makeup tips over coffee, peppermints, loose change, bathroom breaks, SOLOS, torturing Will (and yes, it's confirmed: he does have a crush on me), great hugs, spankings, whispering during concerts, dressing up like princesses, and teaching me that being a girl= AWESOME! Eh, I'd write more but I'm awesome. To all of you who haven't been mentioned, please remember me with all of my good moments and *sigh* my not so pleasurable ones. I love you all immensely even when I forget to mention it. Thanks for a wild weekend. Maybe we can do it again some time. *For those of you who are unaware of the origin of the DiAmOnDeEv a, please remind me to tell that story sometime soon.

Hmm. I was just reading a survey on a certain Salem Academy rising junior who shall remain unnamed (ok so I lied *SARAH LIVENGOOD*) and it featured some really ridiculous questions including who is your "hyperest" friend. ......that's not a word.

Ok so, a lot of people in J-town are really upset with Dr. Rogers and Terry Grier because they are banning flip flops from school premises. There are petitions and all kinds of hoopla going down. Although I do agree with the absurdity of this new rule, I also think that there are much more important things going on not just in the world, but in Guilford County, that are whole lot more vital than whether you can wear your rainbow flip flops to class. It just seems to me that if you're going to crusade for something, make it something that isn't totally self-righteous. Some people can't even afford to buy flip flops. It is amazing to me that in this time of great poverty and turmoil, the number one problem that being attacked is footwear in schools. I guess that's the worst thing a suburban girl could imagine.

So last night I dreamt that we were having this random Salem review of very random songs from musicals. It involved me singing "Diamonds are a girls best friend (in Moulin Rouge style with me as Nicole Kidman and Gabrielle as Harry Z)" and then Elizabeth King and someone else singing "Nowadays" from Chicago. Kind of strange.

So today, while I was daydreaming (ok, sleeping) at work, I dreamt that Linzi and I were just strolling through Thruway one day when this random guy walked up to us in Borders and told us that we were just the kind of girls that he was looking for. So he herded us out into this limo (ok, one question: this guy could have been totally psycho. Why the hell were we going with him?). When we were in the limo he put us on this camera phone with this old guy, obviously his boss. The old guy said he was looking for two young and gorgeous girls (oh, the flattery) to use his Guilford County estate for our entire spring break and he would foot the bills for everything. ‘Twas his final wish. (Ok, as unrealistic as this may sound, bear with me here..) Of course Linz and I graciously accepted his offer. It was, after all, the VERY least we could do. So after school let out for SB, a stretch hummer arrived at Salem, picked us up and drove us out to his massive estate in the foothills of the piedmont. Seriously the house was fucking ridiculous, just like Salem only bigger. And to be used only be the two of us for almost two weeks. We promptly decided that every night we would give a massive dinner for all of our friends and then on our last night in the house we would host a blowout party where the key ingredients were liquor, sex, and blasting music. But for some reason the house was totally unfurnished so we went through every furniture catalogue on the planet and spent hundreds of thousands of dollars furnishing it. It cost a lot but who cares? We weren’t paying for it. And then each night we threw these great dinner parties in this huge dining room/ballroom and each night, we would serve these gourmet dishes prepared by our own kitchen staff and served by our butlers (we had all the silverware and everything). And then on the last night we threw this massive party. It was like the party of my dreams but sadly, I remember basically nothing from it except that Linz wore a green, blue and white striped polo dress, green and white push down socks, and green, blue and white high top Reebok heels. And I wore a pink garbadine skirt-suit edged in purple, silver, and black (my favorite colors), black tights with silver edging, and purple, pink, silver and black Chuck Taylor heels. But after that I just remember a lot of drinking (and I mean A LOT of drinking) people swimming naked in this random lake, and a lot of popcorn. And there was this great pillow fight at around 2am. And at some point Arlane, Joanna Faulkenberry, Veronica, Maebeth, Mary Layton and I went out for pizzas and beer (not even like we were bringing pizza back for everyone else; we like, went to Little Ceasers and ate inside). And somehow we ended up in this tiny bar and we all danced on top of the tables in our underwear (I remember that I was wearing black tap pants and Joanna was wearing a g-string. Kind of funny…) And then the next thing I remember is that it was the next morning and some people had left but most of them were just sprawled around the house. Linzi and I woke up late and we were still like, some of the first people to wake up. After I made myself this huge bowl of cereal, I walked through the living room where Kate, Joanna F., Sarah B., Scott (that kid from Borders), and my friend Josh (very random) were watching cartoons and eating cereal. Then I walked out to the back deck where Linzi was eating a slice of pizza and smoking a philly and I lit a clove and she looked at me and was like “best party ever” and I was like “amen”. It was amazing. So now I’ve resolved that because of this dream, next year the whole dance scene will be tremendous (what with me as Dance committee prez and her as fellowship council prez). In fact, now I really want to have a party like, during orientation. A sort of “get to know how fucked up we are” kind of thing, what do you think? Any comments?
